contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox lake |lake_name = Hidden Lake |image_lake = Hidden Lake AB 1994.jpg |caption_lake = Hidden Lake from [[Mount Richardson (Alberta)|Mount Richardson]] |image_bathymetry = |caption_bathymetry = |location = [[Slate Range (Alberta)|Slate Range]], [[Banff National Park]], [[Alberta]] |coords = {{Coord|51|29|05|N|116|06|31|W|scale:15000_type:waterbody_region:CA-AB|display=inline,title}} |type = [[Glacial lake]] |inflow = |outflow = Corral Creek |catchment = |basin_countries = Canada |length = {{convert|405|m|ft|abbr=on}} |width = {{convert|380|m|ft|abbr=on}} |area = {{convert|0.4|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}} |depth = |max-depth = Unknown |volume = |residence_time = |shore = |elevation = {{convert|2300|m|ft|abbr=on}} |islands = |cities = }} '''Hidden Lake''' is a small [[glacial lake]] in the [[Skoki Valley]] of [[Banff National Park]], [[Canada]]. It is located in the [[Slate Range (Alberta)|Slate Range]] of the [[Canadian Rockies]]. The lake can be reached by following a [[hiking]] trail for {{convert|8.4|km|mi|abbr=on}} starting at Fish Creek, at the base of the [[Lake Louise Ski Area]], near [[Lake Louise, Alberta|Lake Louise]]. A backcountry [[campground]] is situated one km before reaching the lake.<ref>{{cite book|authors=Brian Patton & Bart Robinson|title=The Canadian Rockies Trail Guide|publisher=Summerthought|year=1986|edition=3rd|pages=103-104}}</ref> The lake is the starting point for possible [[Mountaineering|ascents]] of [[Mount Richardson (Alberta)|Mount Richardson]], [[Pika Peak]] and [[Ptarmigan Peak (Alberta)|Ptarmigan Peak]]. The [[glacial lake|glacial]] waters of the lake are drained by Corral Creek through the Sikoki Valley into the [[Bow River]]. ==See also== *[[List of lakes of Alberta]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Alberta rivers and lakes}} [[Category:Banff National Park]] [[Category:Lakes of Alberta]] [[Category:Mountain lakes]] [[Category:Glacial lakes of Canada]] {{Alberta-geo-stub}}
